title: New player experience — first-match clarity audit
description:
Imagine a player who has NEVER played this game opening it for the first time. Walk through their experience:

1. Setup screen: Do they understand what archetypes mean? Are stat labels (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA) clear?
2. Loadout screen: Is gear/rarity/variant selection overwhelming? What could be simplified for first-timers?
3. Speed selection: Do they understand the speed/power tradeoff?
4. Attack selection: Can they learn the counter system? Are hints sufficient?
5. Pass results: Can they understand what happened and WHY they won/lost?
6. Melee phase: Is the transition clear? Do they understand the new attack set?

Propose improvements focused on CLARITY, not dumbing down. Write analysis to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-2.md.

Acceptance criteria: Walkthrough of first-match experience with at least 3 clarity improvement proposals ranked by impact.

title: ARIA attributes and semantic markup for accessibility — COMPLETE
description: ✅ COMPLETED Round 1: Extended accessibility to SpeedSelect.tsx and AttackSelect.tsx (attack cards + melee wins dots). All interactive elements now keyboard-navigable with proper aria-labels. 822→830 tests (no breakage). Ready for deployment.

title: Rare/epic tier balance sweep (fill tier gap)
description:
Round 1 baseline covered bare/uncommon/giga but skipped rare/epic. Run N=200 rare and epic tier simulations to:

1. Fill tier gap in balance understanding
2. Verify Charger progression (bare 41%→epic peak→giga 47%)
3. Verify Technician buff doesn't spike at rare/epic
4. Map Bulwark dominance fade pattern (bare 61.4%→uncommon 58%→?rare?→?epic?→giga 50%)

Write findings to orchestrator/analysis/balance-tuner-round-2.md.

Acceptance criteria: Rare and epic tier win rates documented, no new balance flags, confidence in tier progression.

title: Gear variant affinity hints + quick build presets (design follow-up)
description:
Follow-up to BL-040 (design analysis complete). Implement designer's 3 proposals:

1. **Affinity labels in variant tooltips**: Show which archetype each variant favors (aggressive→Charger, defensive→Breaker, balanced→neutral)
2. **Quick Builds section** on LoadoutScreen: 3 pre-configured buttons (Aggressive Charger, Defensive Breaker, Balanced Duelist) that auto-select steed/player gear variants
3. **Matchup hint**: Display estimated win rate for current archetype+variant combo vs opponent (requires integration with simulate.ts)

Update LoadoutScreen.tsx with new UI sections + App.css styling.

Acceptance criteria: All 3 proposals UI-complete, 830+ tests passing, tooltips informative, quick builds auto-populate correctly.

title: Melee carryover + softCap interaction tests
description:
QA coverage gap: Melee carryover + softCap interactions are only partially tested. Add 10-15 new tests to gear-variants.test.ts:

1. Melee round winner carries stamina over to next round with softCap applied
2. Stats crossing knee between rounds (e.g., fatigued below knee, then recovered above knee)
3. SoftCap + counter bonus scaling (e.g., 150 MOM → 133 after softCap → 136.3 after 0.1 counter bonus)
4. Breaker guard penetration + softCap interaction (penetration applied pre-softCap or post?)
5. Extreme giga cases (all stats >110, both softCapped to 133)

Write tests to src/engine/gear-variants.test.ts, update test-count in handoff.

Acceptance criteria: 10-15 new tests added, all passing, zero regressions, coverage report included in handoff.

title: Stat bar animations + rarity glow stacking (polish stretch)
description:
Optional polish enhancements (not blocking):

1. **Stat bar smooth fill**: Add 0.4s ease-in-out transition to stat bars (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA) when values change during match
2. **Rarity glow stacking**: Epic gear gets 1x glow, Legendary 2x overlapping glows, Relic 3x (additive shadows for depth)
3. **Disabled state styling**: When player can't take action (out of stamina, phase locked), add opacity 0.5 + cursor: not-allowed to disabled buttons

Update src/App.css with new animation keyframes + modifier classes.

Acceptance criteria: All animations smooth at 60fps on mobile, prefers-reduced-motion still honored, no visual regressions, 830+ tests passing.
